intro: Anagallis grandiflora, commonly known as the greater knotweed or redmaids, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Anagallis grandiflora is an annual plant that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
